circumstances: Nathan Read was reported missing after being last seen leaving his home in Wester Millerhill, Dalkeith. Concerned family members, including his son and brother, noted that Nathan had a history of frequent visits to a remote cabin near 2 Cramond Glebe Road, Edinburgh. He was believed to be squatting in various locations across the city and was known for his illegal employment status, which added complexity to his whereabouts. A friend had mentioned Nathan's interest in the art scene around 91,93 Princes Street, adding to the mystery of his disappearance. After an extensive search, including known areas of refuge, he was eventually traced by police at 19 West Port, Dunbar, safe and unharmed, much to the relief of his family. Despite his wandering tendencies, Nathan expressed gratitude upon his return and promised to be more communicative regarding his whereabouts.

circumstances: Nathan Read was last seen leaving his home in Wester Millerhill, Dalkeith. He had a scheduled appointment at the doctor's office, but never arrived, leading his family to grow concerned. Reports from his son and brother highlighted his recent tendency to avoid collecting his prescribed medication. Concerned for his well-being, they alerted the authorities. Investigations revealed that Nathan might have been squatting at an address on Abbotsford Road, North Berwick. After days of searching, he was eventually located by the police at 50 Howden Hall Road, Edinburgh. Throughout his brief disappearance, Nathan appeared to have deliberately avoided contact but was found safe and in good health, with no immediate medical concerns upon his return.
